meanings.definition: A period of time spent doing a particular job or activity.
meanings.sent1: During his stint as a waiter, he learned how to balance plates.
meanings.sent2: She completed her stint as a volunteer at the animal shelter.
meanings.sent3: His stint as a student council president was filled with exciting challenges.
meanings.sent4: The actress's stint on Broadway was a whirlwind of rehearsals and performances.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut's stint in space felt like a dream come true.

meanings.definition: To restrict or limit in amount or number.
meanings.sent1: The doctor advised him to stint on sugary snacks for better health.
meanings.sent2: She decided to stint her expenses to save money for a vacation.
meanings.sent3: He would never stint on kindness, always helping those in need.
meanings.sent4: The chef refused to stint on quality ingredients for his signature dish.
meanings.sent5: The coach warned the players not to stint on their efforts during the game.

meanings.sent1: They had to stint on electricity usage during the power outage.
meanings.sent2: She would never stint on love and care for her pets.
meanings.sent3: He decided to stint on unnecessary purchases to save for a rainy day.
meanings.sent4: The artist would never stint on creativity, always exploring new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The gardener would never stint on watering the plants, ensuring they thrived.
